title: Plant Disease Treatment
description: This involves addressing issues like fungal or bacterial infections with specific fungicides, bactericides, or other treatments. For example, using copper fungicides to treat blight or bacterial infections.

title: Pest Control
description: Controlling pests like aphids, mites, or scale insects using insecticides or other methods. For example, using soap solutions or neem oil to deter pests.

title: Fertilization
description: Providing plants with essential nutrients, such as nitrogen, phosphorus, and potassium, through fertilizers. For example, using slow-release fertilizers to ensure a steady supply of nutrients.

title: Watering
description: Maintaining proper soil moisture levels to support healthy growth and prevent stress. For example, watering deeply but less frequently to encourage root development.

title: Pruning
description: Removing dead or diseased branches, shaping plants, and promoting growth. For example, pruning shrubs to improve air circulation and light penetration.

title: Propagation
description: Creating new plants from existing ones through techniques like cuttings, layering, or seeds. For example, propagating succulents by taking stem cuttings.
